level.heading: Expenses of sale; deposit of net proceeds.

level.text: The Mayor is further authorized to pay the reasonable and necessary expenses of sale of each parcel of land sold and shall deposit the net proceeds of the sale in the District Treasury.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: D.C. Law 18-223, in subsec. (b)(2), substituted "Except as provided in § 10-701(a), the Mayor" for "The Mayor".
D.C. Law 19-21, in subsec. (a), substituted "sold and" for "sold and, the exception of the property mentioned in subsection (b) of this section,"; and repealed subsec. (b).
The 2012 amendment by D.C. Law 19-171 added a comma preceding "with the exception" and following "of this section" " in (b) [now repealed].

level.heading: Temporary Amendment of Section
level.text: For temporary (225 day) amendment of section, see § 2 of Miner Building Conveyance Temporary Amendment Act of 1994 (D.C. Law 10-161, August 25, 1994, law notification 41 DCR 6396).

level.heading: Emergency Legislation
level.text: For temporary amendment of section, see § 2 of the Miner Building Conveyance Emergency Amendment Act of 1994 (D.C. Act 10-256, June 23, 1994, 41 DCR 4472).
For temporary (90 day) amendment of section, see § 1003 of Fiscal Year 2011 Budget Support Emergency Act of 2010 (D.C. Act 18-463, July 2, 2010, 57 DCR 6542).

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 8-158
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 8-158, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 10-801.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 19-21
level.text: For history of Law 19-21, see notes under § 10-301.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 19-171
level.text: Law 19-171, the "Technical Amendments Act of 2012," was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 19-397. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on Mar. 20, 2012, and Apr. 17, 2012, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on May 23, 2012, it was assigned Act No. 19-376 and transmitted to Congress for its review. D.C. Law 19-171 became effective on September 26, 2012.
